title.narrative: YRS civil society organisations within environment in Serbia
YRS civilsamhällesorganisationer inom miljösektorn i Serbien

description.narrative:
Organisationen Young Researchers of Serbia (YRS) har till Sida inkommit med en ansökan om finansiering med 16 miljoner kronor för att utföra programmet för Serbien "ECO SYSTEM Environmental Reforms Supporting Programme" under perioden 2019-2022. Insatsen syftar till att stärka det civila samhällets organisationers möjlighet att ta aktiv del i Serbiens EU närmande.
Det övergripande målet med programmet är att skydda naturresurser, försvara människors miljörättigheter, samt främja och institutionalisera förbättrat miljöskydd och stärka Serbiens EU reformer särskilt inom Kapitel 27.
Insatsen kommer att bidra till en effektiv operationalisering av resultatstrategin avseende Strategi Resultat R8 under strategiperioden och de kommande åren därefter.
Programmets totala budget är 16 miljoner kronor, varav organisationens egen insats är noll kronor. Det finns inga andra givare för programmet. Programmet kommer att vidareförmedla ungefär 7 miljoner kronor till lokala civilsamhällesorganisationer i Serbien.

The organisation Young Researchers of Serbia have requested from Sida finansing of 16 million SEK for their planned programme in Serbia 2019-2022. The contribution aims to strengthen civil society in order for it to be able to take a more active role in Serbia's EU integration process.
The goal of the programme is to protect the natural resources, defend people's environmental rights, promote and institutionalise improved environmental protection and other issues related EU reforms, and in particular with regard to Serbia's Chapter 27 process.
The contribution is expected to contribute to an efficient operationalisation of the Results Strategy in the startegy period, and specifically its Result 8.
The intervention total budget is 16 million SEK, out of which the organisation’s own funding is zero SEK.
Approximately 7 million SEK of the intervention budget will be forwarded to local civil society organisations in Serbia.

Question: Summarise the intervention logicAnswer: This intervention aims to generate domestic force that will safeguard the space for further development and democratisation, by supporting civil society in their efforts for environmental protection, environmental human rights and advocacy and promotion of the primary importance for Serbia’s EU integrations. Civil society development will also work to enhance the adequate civic response in addressing gaps between citizens and governments, thus restoring the public confidence and trust in institutions. By raising awareness of civil society partners’ democratisation efforts, this intervention will aim to help improve the general level of trust towards the civil society sector as generator of democratic development, and will raise citizens’ awareness of benefits of democratization and EU integration process specifically related to environmental awareness and reforms related to EU Chapter 27.

tag.narrative: 13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

title.narrative: Young Researchers of Serbia, support to environmental CSOs Agreement
Young Researchers of Serbia, support to environmental CSOs Decision

description.narrative: This Conclusion on Performance is based on information provided through continuous follow-up of the contribution through field visits, meetings and dialogue, as well as the programme reporting. The Embassy considers that interaction with our cooperation partner is the most important part of the follow-up of the intervention. In response to corona crisis, the Embassy engaged to intensify dialogue with our partners on changed conditions for their activities to assess whether there are risks of not being able to implement parts of planned and agreed activities, and what adjustments to budgets and plans may be justified. The Embassy's starting point is to take a flexible approach to making justified adjustments to plans and budgets and -as always - the starting point is that aid should have as high effectiveness as possible. Young Researchers of Serbia (YRS) reported that the Inception Phase of the Programme (Jan-April 2020) was implemented as planned, and with no obstacles. All planned activities were conducted, while the planned Kick-off event is postponed due to the COVID-19 emergency. The programme’s Inception phase provided important inputs from stakeholders and beneficiaries for the three main groups of activities: Environmental Impact Hub, Grants for Environmental CSOs, Environmental protection campaign. In line with the approved programme plans, the YRS initiated the process of development of the granting methodology, and it is currently under review of the Embassy Frame Auditors. This is also the one remaining ISK recommendation to be implemented. The grant forwarding is planned for the second programme year (2021). The Environmental Impact Hub (Oikos podrška) under the programme has been in place and already started with first activities: analysing environmental networks (through short questionnaire), participating in decision making processes related to the environmental protection (e.g. sending CSOs input for development of Spatial Plan of the Republic of Serbia for period till 2035) and analysing needs for online learning (courses to be developed on YRS’ online platform). The aim is that the Hub will work on: (I) building capacities of CSOs on environmental EU acquis, monitoring environmental policies, advocacy environmental protectionmeasures and better transposition and implementation of EU acquis, mainstreaminggender in environmental sector and improving performance and visibility of environmental CSOs; (II) strengthening networking and cooperation among CSOs, between CSOs and institutions and increasing public participation in environmental decision making. The Hub Team (4 staff) has also initiated cooperation with other hubs such as Resource centre withinEU supported TASCO project and Swiss funded civil society support ACT project (bothimplemented by Civic Initiatives) in order to create coordination and possible synergies.Coordination is maintained with donors but also with the most relevant institutionalstakeholders. Coordination is also maintained with other related Sida funded civil societysupport programmes. The YRS maintains close coordination with the related Sida funded EISP programme and EUD related measures to support environmental reforms. The YRS programme team was during the summer 2020 active on visibility and communication planning, and the Comminication Plan is presented, including inputs and guidance from the Embassy Communication Officer (Political Section of the Embassy). In September 2020 the YRS motivated that savings made under corona circumstances on budgeted travel, accommodation and related, are instead invested in strengthened IT solutions for switching activities to online, including the programme promotional event wghere YRS already was in active communication with the Embassy Political Section. The YRS for this purpose proposed to strengthen the already existing their online platform for capacity building, for the sake of efficiency , sustainable IT solutions, long term planning and after all YRS sustainability. The Embassy approved this request following internal consultations including the Sida S Operational Controller. The YRS was active in preparations of the annual Shadow Report of Coalition 27 (which is a group of civil society organisations engaged in following the EU Chapter 27 process). The report contains also recommendations for needed reforms and explanations of the problems in the environmental sector and inputs from local communities. This is the seventh Coallition 27 shadow report, it is named this year "Walking in the Mist" which reflects the view of Coalition 27 that decision-making processes in the field of environmental protection and climate change are still not sufficiently transparent. The report was presented in October 2020 https://rs.boell.org/en/2020/10/08/walking-mist-coalition-27-shadow-report-2020 .
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
